fields.name: location_information_header
fields.content: 1. Your property

fields.name: location_why
fields.content: At the end of this survey you will be able to hide your contact information and location information or voluntarily choose to make it public for the VSP report.

fields.name: drag_map_info
fields.content: Please drag and zoom the map to center the pin on your property.

fields.name: address
fields.prompt: Or, search by address:
fields.placeholder: Your address will never be shared

fields.name: analysis_units_header
fields.content: 2. Watersheds

fields.name: analysis_unit
fields.prompt: Of the nine watersheds on the map, in which do you primarily farm?

fields.name: wetlands_header
fields.content:
3. Wetland Areas

Description

Wetland areas are inundated or saturated by surface water or groundwater.

Appearance on map

Palustrine

Lacustrine Limnetic

Lacustrine Littoral

Riverine Lower Perennial

Riverine Upper Perennial

Riverine Intermittent

fields.name: private-property_on_wetlands
fields.prompt: Does your property lie on any wetlands?

fields.name: toggle_wetlands
fields.content: Click the icon on the map and select "Wetlands" to toggle wetlands data.

fields.name: frequently_flooded_header
fields.content:
4. Frequently Flooded Areas

Description

Frequently flooded areas are subject to a 1% or greater chance of flooding every year.

Appearance on map

500-year floodplain

100-year floodplain

fields.name: private-property_on_frequently_flooded
fields.prompt: Does your property lie on any frequently flooded areas?

fields.name: toggle_frequently_flooded
fields.content: Click the icon on the map and select "Frequently Flooded Areas" to toggle frequently flooded data.

fields.name: geologic_hazard_header
fields.content:
5. Severe Geologic Hazard Areas

Description

Severe geologic hazard areas are susceptible to erosion, sliding, earthquakes, and other events.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_geologic_hazard
fields.prompt: Does your property lie on any severe geologic hazard areas?

fields.name: toggle_geologic_hazard
fields.content: Click the icon on the map and select "Geologic Hazards" to toggle geologic hazard data.

fields.name: critical_aquifer_header
fields.content:
6. Critical Aquifer Recharge Areas

Description

Critical aquifer recharge areas have a critical effect on aquifers used for potable water.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_critical_aquifer
fields.prompt: Does your property lie on any critical aquifer recharge areas?

fields.name: toggle_critical_aquifer
fields.content: Click the icon on the map and select "Critical Aquifer Recharge Areas" to toggle critical aquifer data.

fields.name: critical_conservation_header
fields.content:
7. Fish & Wildlife Habitat Conservation Areas

Description

Fish & wildlife habitat conservation areas are managed to maintain habitats of fish and wildlife. Zoom the map to explore species types.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_critical_conservation
fields.prompt: Does your property lie on any critical conservation areas?

fields.name: toggle_critical_conservation
fields.content: Click the icon on the map and select "Critical Conservation Areas" to toggle critical conservation data.

fields.name: farming_history_header
fields.content:
8. Your Farming History

Please fill out the form below to report yourfarming history.

fields.name: acres_farmed
fields.prompt: How many acres do you farm?

fields.name: years_farming
fields.prompt: How many years have you been farming?

fields.name: tillage_header
fields.content:
9. Tillage

Please fill out the form below to report your tillage practices.

content.label: This section is not relevant to me. Proceed to next section. 
This section is not relevant to me. Proceed to next section. 

fields.name: no_till
fields.prompt: No till
fields.label: No till

body: This practice leaves the soil and crop residue undisturbed except for crop row where the seed and fertilizer is placed in the ground. No Till planters disturb less than 25% of the row width.

fields.name: no_till_quantity
fields.prompt: On how many acres do you practice no till?

fields.name: no_till_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been practicing no till?

fields.name: mulch_till
fields.prompt: Mulch till
fields.label: Mulch till

body: This practice includes tillage methods commonly referred to as mulch tillage where a majority of the soil surface is disturbed by noninversion tillage operations such as vertical tillage, chiseling, and disking, and also includes tillage/planting systems with relatively minimal soil disturbance.

fields.name: mulch_till_quantity
fields.prompt: On how many acres do you use mulch till techniques?

fields.name: mulch_till_type
fields.prompt: Which type of seeding drill do you use?

content.label: Someone else is custom seeding for me

fields.name: mulch_till_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been using mulch till techniques?

fields.name: nutrients
fields.content:
10. Nutrient Management

Please fill out the form below to report your nutrient management practices.

content.label: This section is not relevant to me. Proceed to next section. 
This section is not relevant to me. Proceed to next section. 

fields.name: basic_soil_tests
fields.prompt: Basic soil tests
fields.label: Basic soil tests

body: Basic soil tests monitor, at a minimum, organic matter, phosphorus (P), potassium (K), pH, and buffer pH every four years.

fields.name: basic_soil_tests_quantity
fields.prompt: On how many acres do you conduct basic soil tests?

fields.name: basic_soil_tests_type
fields.prompt: Which type of soil test do you use?

fields.name: basic_soil_tests_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been conducting soil tests?

fields.name: biosolids
fields.prompt: Biosolids management
fields.label: Control biosolids

body: Municipal and, especially, industrial biosolids can be sources of heavy metals.

fields.name: biosolids_quantity
fields.prompt: How many tons of biosolids do you manage?

fields.name: biosolids_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been managing biosolids?

fields.name: precision_soil_tests
fields.prompt: Precision soil tests or mapping
fields.label: Precision soil tests / mapping

fields.name: precision_soil_tests_quantity
fields.prompt: On how many acres do you conduct precision soil tests?

fields.name: precision_soil_tests_type
fields.prompt: Which type of soil test or mapping do you use?

fields.name: precision_soil_tests_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been conducting precision soil tests or mapping?

fields.name: buffers
fields.content:
11. Buffers

Please fill out the form below to report your usage of buffers on your property.

content.label: This section is not relevant to me. Proceed to next section. 
This section is not relevant to me. Proceed to next section. 

fields.name: grassed_waterways
fields.prompt: Grassed waterways
fields.label: Grassed waterways

body: A grassed waterway is a shaped or graded channel that is established with suitable vegetation to convey surface water at a non-erosive velocity using a broad and shallow cross section to a stable outlet.

fields.name: grassed_waterways_quantity
fields.prompt: On how many acres do you use grassed waterways?

fields.name: grassed_waterways_type
fields.prompt: Which type of grassed waterways do you use?

fields.name: grassed_waterways_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been using grassed waterways?

fields.name: commodity_buffer
fields.prompt: I participate in the commodity buffer program
fields.label: Commodity buffer program

fields.name: commodity_buffer_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been participating in the commodity buffer program?

fields.name: riparian_forest
fields.prompt: Riparian tree and shrub planting
fields.label: Riparian forest planting

body: A corridor of trees and/or shrubs planted adjacent to a river, stream, wetland or water body. The planting is of sufficient width and up-gradient and near the water body to insure adequate functioning for the desired purpose.

fields.name: riparian_forest_quantity
fields.prompt: How many acres of riparian forest have you planted?

fields.name: riparian_forest_type
fields.prompt: Which type of riparian forest have you planted?

fields.name: riparian_forest_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been planting riparian forests?

fields.name: livestock
fields.content:
12. Livestock

Please fill out the form below to report your livestock management practices.

content.label: This section is not relevant to me. Proceed to next section. 
This section is not relevant to me. Proceed to next section. 

fields.name: stream_crossing
fields.prompt: Stream crossings
fields.label: Stream crossings

body: A stream crossing is a stabilized area or structure constructed across a stream to provide a travel way for people, livestock, equipment, or vehicles.

fields.name: stream_crossing_quantity
fields.prompt: How many stream crossings have you installed

fields.name: stream_crossing_type
fields.prompt: Which type of stream crossing have you installed?

fields.name: stream_crossing_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been installing stream crossings?

fields.name: heavy_use_area
fields.prompt: My operation has a designated heavy use area
fields.label: Heavy use area protection

body: The stabilization of areas frequently and intensively used by people, animals or vehicles by establishing vegetative cover, surfacing with suitable materials, and/or installing needed structures.

fields.name: heavy_use_area_description
fields.prompt: Please describe your heavy use area in detail:
fields.placeholder: Describe your designated heavy use area

fields.name: heavy_use_area_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you had a designated heavy use areas?

fields.name: fencing
fields.prompt: Fencing
fields.label: Fencing

body: There are many different purposes for and types of fences. Generally, fences shall be appropriately planned, designed, and installed to control the animal(s), vehicles, or people of concern.

fields.name: fencing_quantity
fields.prompt: How many feet of fencing have you installed?

fields.name: fencing_type
fields.prompt: Which type of fencing have you installed?

fields.name: fencing_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been installing and maintaining fencing?

fields.name: nutrient_management
fields.prompt: Nutrient management
fields.label: Nutrient management

body: Managing the amount (rate), source, placement (method of application), and timing of plant nutrients and soil amendments.

fields.name: nutrient_management_quantity
fields.prompt: On how many acres do you practice nutrient management?

fields.name: nutrient_management_type
fields.prompt: Which type of nutrient management do you practice?

fields.name: nutrient_management_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been practicing nutrient management?

fields.name: pipeline
fields.prompt: Pipelines
fields.label: Pipelines

body: Pipeline having an inside diameter of 8 inches or less to achieve one or more of the following purposes: (1) convey water from a source of supply to points of use for livestock, wildlife, or recreation; (2) reduce energy use; or (3) develop renewale energy systems (i.e., in-pipe hydropower).

fields.name: pipeline_quantity
fields.prompt: How many feet of pipeline do you maintain?

fields.name: pipeline_type
fields.prompt: Which type of pipeline do you maintain?

fields.name: pipeline_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been installing and maintaining pipelines?

fields.name: other
fields.content:
13. Other Stewardship Practices

Please fill out the form below to report any other stewardship practices on your property.

fields.name: other_practices_description
fields.prompt: Please describe your other stewardship practices:

fields.name: additional_info_header
fields.content:
14. Almost completed!

Thank you for taking the time to voluntarily report your stewardship practices.

fields.label: Upload photos

fields.name: practices_description
fields.prompt: Add a description of your stewardship practices!

fields.prompt: What challenges or difficulties have you experienced as a voluntary steward?

content.label: I have a Farm Plan or Stewardship Plan in place

fields.name: land_ownership
fields.prompt: Who owns the land that you work? Please check all that apply:

fields.name: private
fields.prompt: Would you be willing to share your stewardship story with the public? Checking "yes" below will place a pin on the map upon submission and your stewardship actions will be visible to the public. (Your address and other property identifying information will not be published.)

content: Your Spokane County VSP Coordinators are interested in helping meet your stewardship goals.
Contact a local VSP Coordinator for more information:

Welcome Spokane County Voluntary Stewards!

Get Started

The Spokane County Voluntary Stewardship Program (VSP) is an innovative approach to reporting the protection of critical areas. By reporting your voluntary stewardship on this site, you'll help Spokane County allocate resources, and you'll help the Spokane County Conservation District learn what types of technical assistance we can provide to you.
Explore your fellow producers' voluntary stewardship actions by clicking pins on the map:
Or, click Get Started to begin reporting your own stewardship!
Spokane Conservation District can assist you in applying for these opportunities.
ACEP: Agriculture Conservation Easement ProgramNRCS (U.S. Department of Agriculture)Federal
EQIP: Environmental Quality Incentives ProgramNRCS (U.S. Department of Agriculture)Federal
